item.title: Relativistic Fully Self-Consistent GW for Molecules: Total Energies and Ionization Potentials
item.description: This paper emphasizes the accuracy of self consistent GW method for heavy element systems.

item.title: Location
item.description: Department of Chemistry 930 N. University Ann Arbor, MI 48109-1055

item.title: Office Hours
item.description: Schedule and location for Professor Dr von Igelfeld's office hours.

item.title: Quantum self-consistent equation-of-motion method for computing molecular excitation energies, ionization potentials, and electron affinities on a quantum computer
item.description: This work explores the development of a novel equation-of-motion-based method for calculating excitation energies on near-term quantum computers, highlighting its advantages for accurately simulating electronically excited states in small molecules.

item.title: Selected Configuration Interaction in a Basis of Cluster State Tensor Products
item.description: The paper introduces tensor product selected configuration interaction (TPSCI), a method that reduces SCI variables by leveraging local molecular structures and many-particle cluster states, demonstrating its effectiveness across various complex systems, including bond breaking and planar nanographenes

item.title: List of Irregular Verbs Across Romance Languages
item.description: This dataset contains all irregular verbs in known Romance languages.

item.title: Lectures at the Villa of Reduced Circumstances
item.description: This graduate course presents classical results in Romance philology.

item.title: Portugese Irregular Verbs
item.description: This book discusses Portugese irregular verbs in great details.

item.title: Profanity in Early Irish
item.description: This undergraduate course discusses profanity in Early Irish.
